page.title: 03Poultry Farming - Alford
page.content: The farmer owns several poultry farms covering 5O acres, but only one at Farlesthorpe, of 8 acres, has been owned since 1951. He has 18O thousand chickens of which 23.5 thousand are at Farlesthorpe.The breeds are:- Iso Brown,Isex,Ross Brown and Ross Ranger.All are egg-laying. Each chicken lays about 28O eggs from one day old to 14 months,when killed. Replacement birds are brought in as day olds. Two people work at Farlesthorpe.One collects the eggs each day, and they are sent to Dalgety, Deans Farm Eggs for packing,for sale at Marks and Spencers,Sainsburys,Tesco,Waitrose, and in Buckinghamshire. The farms produce a total of 12O tons of food _ of which 2O tons go to Farlesthorpe.
